page.title: 15SCHOOLS IN AYLESFORD&ECCLES
page.content: There are two schools,both primary,which are Church of England controlled & share a common governing body chaired by the local incumbert. St Marks Infants School founded in 1882 has 29 pupils taught by 2 teachers.St Peters School is unusual as it is housed on both sides of the Medway.The Junior Dept admits chdn from its own infants dept & St Marks. St Peters has 120 chdn on roll taught by 4 teachers plus the Head.Buildings date from 1850,playing areas are limited & accommodation restricted.A new building is planned.Pre-school playgroups are held in both villages. Children can join at 3yrs of age & have play experience and social training enabling them to transfer to school happily at 5yrs.
